summary: chelsea have made an offer for fc tokyo 's yoshinori muto . japan international will join chelsea 's vitesse arnhem on loan next season . muto claims chelsea 's interest in muto is not connected to the # 200million deal they signed with yokohama rubber in february .

aspect: 1. FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto has received a bid from Chelsea with a £4million deal being mooted.
2. Chelsea have expressed interest in Japan international Muto but their £200million sponsorship deal with Japanese company Yokohama Rubber is not connected to the interest.

3. Muto is a young striker who has been making waves in Japan with his performances for FC Tokyo, scoring 13 goals in his debut season and being named in the J-League's best XI. Chelsea have made a formal offer for him with conditions, and while he admits it is an honour, he has not yet decided to join the club.
explain: The aspect states that Chelsea has made a £4million bid for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto. Muto is also slated to join the Dutch club Vitesse Arnhem on a season-long loan. It is reported that this move is not connected to Chelsea's £200million deal with Yokohama Rubber in February.

Chelsea's sponsorship deal with Yokohama Rubber is not linked to their interest in Japanese striker Muto, as suggested in the given aspect. The club's recent £200million contract has no impact on their transfer decisions.

The aspect highlights the interest of Chelsea Football Club in signing Japanese striker, Yoshinori Muto from FC Tokyo. The young striker had a successful debut season, scoring 13 goals and was named in the J-League's best XI. Muto's performance has caught the attention of the premier league club, who have made a formal offer for him with conditions. Muto acknowledges the offer as an honor, but has not yet decided to join the club.
